result.name: investors-in-people-employer-survey
result.notes: The aim of this survey is to explore employer's experiences of working towards Investors in People (IiP) and  the changes made to meet IiP standards as well as the support needed and received throughout the process. The study also measures the prominence and role of IiP within employer's HR and business strategies, the impact upon these employers of gaining IiP and their overall satisfaction.

organization.name: uk-commission-for-employment-and-skills
organization.title: UK Commission for Employment and Skills

result.title: Investors in People: Employer Survey

extras.value: N/A Internal Use Only.  Due to the sensitive nature of this information and the fact that it was received in confidence, this information will not be released. The UK Commission for Employment and Skills also considers that disclosure of this  information would be likely to prejudice commercial interests.  Evidence reports drawing on the data are publicly available at: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/evaluation-of-investors-in-people-year-2 & https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/evaluation-of-investors-in-people-year-1.
